article.title: Saxon/C API
article.p: This section describes the Saxon/C API. The APIs support the specifications XSLT 3.0, XQuery 3.1, Schema Validation 1.0/1.1 and XPath 3.1. Saxon/C can be used in the following langauges: C/C++, PHP and Python. Below we provide links to the APIs for those langauages.
The Saxon/C API provides four main classes across lanaguages C++, PHP and Python.

td.p: An SaxonProcessor acts as a factory for generating XQuery, XPath, Schema and XSLT compilers. This class is itself the context that needs to be managed (i.e. allocation & release resources)
An XsltProcessor represents factory to compile, load and execute a stylesheet. It is possible to cache the context and the stylesheet in the XsltProcessor
An PyXQueryProcessor object represents factory to compile, load and execute queries.
An XPathProcessor represents factory to compile, load and execute the XPath query.
An SchemaValidator represents factory for validating instance documents against a schema.

section.title: Saxon/C C++ API
section.p: Saxon/C is built by cross compiling the Java code of Saxon 9.9.1.5 using the Excelsior Jet Enterprise 15.3 edition(MP1). This generates platform specific machine code, which we interface with C/C++ using the Java Native Interace (JNI). The following Saxon/C API classes are available in C++ to processor in XSLT, XQuery, XPath and Schema validation: SaxonProcessor, XsltProcessor, Xslt30Processor, XPathProcessor, XQueryProcessor and SchemaValidator. We also have class for a sub-set of the XDM data model: XdmValue, XdmNode, XdmItem and XdmAtomicValue.
See the API class list: C++ documentation

section.title: Saxon/C Python API
section.p: The Saxon/C Python extension API has been developed using Cython. Saxon/C only supports Python3. Cython is required to build the extension library.

The Python API is split up in the following class (links are to the equivalent C++ classes): PySaxonProcessor, PyXsltProcessor, PyXslt30Processor, PyXPathProcessor, PyXQueryProcessor and PySchemaValidator. We also have class for a sub-set of the XDM data model: PyXdmValue, PyXdmNode, PyXdmItem and PyXdmAtomicValue.
